website_summaries.verdict: Everything you need in a pedometer for tracking your fitness goals in an attractive, wearable design.
pros: A top model by a brand that set the bar in fitness-tracking tech
Monitors various fitness modes and goals and is extremely intuitive, attractive, and comfortable
cons: Not compatible with all smart devices

customer_reviews.title: Only open app a few times a day to sync (then close) and only one device.
customer_reviews.text: The trick to using this device is to CLOSE the app when you're not syncing. I only sync three to four times a day, then I promptly CLOSE the app. Additionally, ONLY use the app on ONE device. (i.e. NOT both your phone and tablet) Doing both of those things, made the battery last for months. Unfortunately, there are NO instructions that come with the device, so you have to figure these things out on your own. That would be my only complaint. For me, this activity tracker works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Zip is a big fat ripoff
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 4 years now. Received a replacement which I lost and now all Fitbit says is "we sent you a replacement, pound sand." The battery lasts a handful of days. I bought a new one last week. The one I got in 2016 was $49, the one I got last week (also from Amazon) was $179.00. I'm pretty sure the cost of living hasn't got up nearly 400% but the price of a Fitbit Zip has. I was hoping for improvement when Google bought it but no such luck.
customer_reviews.author: R1952

customer_reviews.title: Needs Lots of Batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Since 2012, I have tried four different Fitbits, Ultra, Zip, One, and Flex 2. Out of all of them, the zip is my favorite, it is simple, basic and the minutes aren't overestimated like the other ones. My only complaint is that the Zip eats up batteries like crazy. Still, it's the one I keep coming back to all these years. However, when I bought it in 2014, it was $46.89. Now it's double the price! I don't think so, I'll look for another brand when my zip finally dies.
customer_reviews.author: RoseFel

customer_reviews.title: Buy from Fitbit.Com & Save $20
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Zip is highly motivating if you want to become more active. It's easy to set up & use. There's no need to charge it; it uses a coin battery that last six months. An alert is provided when the battery starts to fail. Amazon currently offers the charcoal colored one for $79. Go to Fitbit.com and order the same thing for $59 w/ free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Lilydune

customer_reviews.title: sorry to see this no longer manufactured
customer_reviews.text: love this little tracker---this is the 2nd one i own. thought i lost the last one, the day after this was delivered i found my original one. fit bit no longer makes these. i much prefer the clip style and really dont need the bells and whistles of the wristband---also i have increased risk for arm swelling and do not wear watches or trackers on my wrist. it is accurate, and i use the computer website, not the app. (no smart cell phone). definitely works for what i need.
customer_reviews.author: dnr mom

customer_reviews.title: I wish that I could recommend the Zip
customer_reviews.text: I wish that I could recommend the Zip. I had one that I loved. After it was stolen, I ordered another one. Now it eats batteries - like I'm lucky if a 2025 battery lasts two weeks. After contacting Fitbit support, their only solution is to not sync using my iOS device because that seems to be draining the battery. I always used my iPhone before and it wasn't a problem. Plus, it isn't any fun competing with my husband in "most steps" battles if I can't sync to my phone. Even though I don't want a wrist worn device, I may have to get one since I can't stand to change the battery so often. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I love my Zip Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I love my Zip Fitbit.....I have tried the wrist type trackers (including the Alta) but, the Zip is more accurate than the wrist type. I put the Zip on the waist on whatever pants/skirt/shorts that I'm wearing and it calculates my steps, miles, and calories (although the calories are inaccurate). I had to figure out my stride length, but after that was measured and put in the Fitbit settings, everything worked perfectly. I walk on a treadmill so I know when the miles are accurate. The calories don't take into effect hills or incline.
customer_reviews.author: LindaKay713

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price. Sooo handy. Easy to use. Excellent support from the Fitbit people. Only minor drawback it that it's so small I have inadverntly placed it in the washer and dryer while it was clipped to a waistband. However, out of the washer or dryer, it works like a charm,. I have checked the steps against an iPhone app and it remains accurate. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Milacaona

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these, first lasted 2 month, the second 5 months. Can't recommend them. First one 'died' after eating 4 batteries in 2 months. By died, I mean replaced the battery and the display remained blank. Tried multiple batteries, display never responded. The second one suddenly quit connecting to my phone. I assumed it was the phone app but the Fitbit never connected again, regardless of device I tried pairing it with. Definitely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: This zip eats batteries,The average length of time is about 20 days And then it dies.The company said it's aware of the problem, but they still have not fixed it. Right now it is useless. I have asked for a replacement working zip but no response yet. Not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad For What it Does
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Zip for several years now; Pros Small Discreet Easy to Use Easy to Customize through the FitBit website ( I only want to see the time and steps). Can't reset the Zip by mistake Cons The tapping gets "old" and annoying Needs a backlight, hard to read in low light Can't disable the idiot smile faces from the display
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this little device. Tells the time, steps, distance and calories. I wouldn't be without it. It's so good I bought a second one. After you set it up the device knows how many calories you should burn when you are inactive. It is pretty accurate too. Great way to make sure you have walked enough steps. It is battery powered so you don''t have to recharge it like the newer ones.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this item
customer_reviews.text: The battery didn't even last 36 hours. After the first day (received the zip at 6 pm, synced around midnight), the zip never synced again. Very disappointed in this item. Have had a fitbit one for years, but that appears to be discontinued. I don't want to wear the fitibit on my wrist as I prefer to wear a watch, so the zip seemed to be a good fit. Not a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Making Reviews Great Again

customer_reviews.title: It's okay. This is more of a "starter" fitbit
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my first Fitbits. I only had 2 complaints really with this. 1) It would come unhooked easily like if you had it hooked on your bra or pocket. 2) The battery life in my opinion wasn't the best. So you were always having to buy a new battery for it since you can't charge it. I think it is a good starter Fitbit though.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my dad's birthday. I set it up and secured it into the clip. He wore it on his belt. Three days later it had popped out. The only thing he had done was walk on the treadmill and get in the car to come home from the gym. We tried all of the find my fitbit apps. They were unsuccessful in locating it. I noticed on forums that this was a known problem. I tried contacting Fitbit who told me they could only offer me a 25% off my next product coupon.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Great add on to my Fitbit Charge.
customer_reviews.text: great addition to my FitBit Charge. Love that I can wear a tracker when I'm dressing up & don't want the Charge on my wrist but don't want to miss out on steps. As long as you dont try to wear Zip & Charge at same time, there's no conflict in syncing to your app. Not sure how much it misses, but then I've never found a unit that was completely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Izzys Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good motivation
customer_reviews.text: The FitBit is a good motivator for me to be more active. I wear the zip clipped to my bra and it tracks everything well but stays hidden. I would probably be better about remembering to wear the watch version, but the watch isn't really my style. So I use the zip and try to remember to take it off my bra and put it in my purse or on my phone for the next day. My only big complaint is that it can be difficult to switch the battery. I ruined my last one by busting the lock w/a nickel. So be careful when changing the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Only 5 weeks of battery life. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little device. Works well. BUT, Fitbit should be ashamed of themselves for marketing this as "Up to 6 months battery life"! A new, quality battery only lasts about 5 weeks. And that is with all features (except step counting) turned off and only syncing manually about once a week. So you will need about 10-12 new batteries each year to use this device.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Great encouragement to excercise more
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother to help her track her steps and possibly encourage her to walk more by competing with other people. Little did I know that as soon as she figured out how to sync it with her smartphone, she would do at least 5,000 - 6,000 steps daily and enter many competitions with friends my age and beat some of them. It also counts burnt calories and total distance walked. Takes 1 CR2025 button battery, same one as you install in desktop computers to store CMOS data.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Ours is faulty
customer_reviews.text: I have a fitbit one that I love and have worn for 4 years. bought this one for my husband and it goes through batteries in less than a week (should last months). I recently lost my one and decided to try wearing his before spending money to reorder the style I had. I dislike that I cant easily see how many steps i've taken - have to sync it to my phone to see an update. Also its not counting steps correctly - instead of zeroing out at midnight it just rolled over so now shows I have way more steps today than I could have possibly taken.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: SYNC PROBLEM.
customer_reviews.text: I loved ZIP when I first got it which was about 6 weeks ago. At 4 weeks I started having problems syncing the device to my computers; two. It stopped syncing all together now. I have followed recommendations on the web site without successfully finding a solution. I have emailed FitBit and have not been offered a solution other than to do what I have done already. If you look at the reviews you will see that the Zip has a history of this very problem. The problem with syncing is not limited to Zip other products FitBit has marketed have the same problem. Read the reviews 3 stars and less and beware.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Battery is supposed to last 6 months per FitBit. I have not gotten more than 6 weeks. I thought was battery but after 3 (last one bought at a different time( it is the FitBit. I have also had numerous issues with it not syncing and I have to turn bluetooth on and off. Disconnect from account and add as a new device.... Even did the Software update when they pushed. Didn't help. Total waste of time/money I had the One and never had this many issues.
customer_reviews.author: DD1286

customer_reviews.title: So done with this
customer_reviews.text: I've had this device or a little over two years and the device works well but it will not sync to the pixel 2 XL . For two years Fitbit has been sending us updates promising that it would at some point sync with our phones. It never has. The battery door is hard to get open to change batteries and today Fitbit released a new version of its app, which I run on my tablet. When I synced it wiped out all of today's steps when it updated. I'm moving to Garmin. I just placed the order.
customer_reviews.author: Bob McCranie

customer_reviews.title: Basic pedometer
customer_reviews.text: First of all, when the device arrived, the battery was dead. I had to buy a new one. The Fitbit Zip will not sync with my Samsung smartphone so I deleted the app out of frustration. I manually keep track of my steps for a walk challenge at work. No instructions came with the device. Fitbit's website is useless. There was no mention of the Zip. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine M.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great--until it breaks. And the replacement breaks, too.
customer_reviews.text: this is such a great device-- when it works. Frustratingly, it doesn't. The first one I got quit working after about 6 months--so I contacted the company and after dealing with them for a bit they sent me a new one. Guess what? The new one broke after a few months, too. Started going haywire-- began resetting itself during the middle of the day, otherwise losing data, flashing the ol' 5.86 number to let me know that's the firmware version. I'm tired of these things breaking after a few months. Looking for a more reliable step counter...
customer_reviews.author: Drew Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit zip shamed on battery life
customer_reviews.text: The first one I had loved it battery life excellent 6 months it finally died and had to have another price went from 69 dollars to 150. But I loved it so I bought well what a mistake tge battery literally only lasts 1 week are you kidding me who can afford that. I have read up on everything an many others are experiencing the same thing. And no answer to be found.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ryer

customer_reviews.title: Entry-level step counter.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in coordination with the Noom dieting app. Only hung up once or twice. The sync took some time to master with my Galaxy S9 Android phone. Kept saying "Device Not Found". One cure is to turn your phone's Bluetooth on and off. But the main thing I learned was to hold the FRONT of my phone against the FitBit Zip on my belt while attempting a sync. Works every time now.
customer_reviews.author: Alan J. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: ... replacement for my One and I couldn't be more disappointed. I've only had it a short time but ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Zip as a replacement for my One and I couldn't be more disappointed. I've only had it a short time but have changed the battery on it twice and the battery low or battery dead sign remains on. I thought the One was a good product and it met my needs. I'm not sure why Fitbit decided to eliminate the One and only offer the Zip as an alternative to the bracelets. I'm not looking for cheap, I'm looking for a non-bracelet option. Very disappointed. Contacted Fitbit through Live Chat and was disappointed with their response to be sure I was using the correct battery.
customer_reviews.author: Karenn

customer_reviews.title: liked it but wouldnt buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these (for me and my husband) and really liked the app and the accuracy of the step counting. But was very disappointed that the device popped out of the rubber casing. Both my husband and I had this happen and lost the fit bit within a month of purchasing it. I would recommend having the open side of the rubber case go inside your pocket so it doesnt pop out. I wouldnt but this again...too much money for something that can pop out so easily.
customer_reviews.author: PamA

customer_reviews.title: I was bored with this after a month
customer_reviews.text: Very glitchy. The battery doesn't stay in unless I cram paper in there with it. Without the paper, the batter loses contact and the FitBit stops recording. The app also seems glitchy. If i input my food with My Fitness Pal, the app will accurately show how many calories I've eaten, and then tell me immediately that I am over my budget for they day, even if I've only eaten 100 calories, so something is clearly wrong there. I was bored with this after a month. Then I finally agreed to add some friends, and the little competitions were motivating. I wish it worked more consistently. I do really like the interaction with the app, though.
customer_reviews.author: S.L.S.

customer_reviews.title: I dont like this, calories burned says 2
customer_reviews.text: I dont like this, calories burned says 2,900 calories approx a day, if I burned all of these calories a day I would be a size ZERO, but instead I am a size 12, and have not lost any weight, not one pound. I hate that this starts off in the morning before I even take one step that I have burned over 460 calories in my sleep, really? I dont even burn that on a treadmill after walking 60 minutes at speed 4.0. So this is inaccurate. I need to know how many calories I burned accurately.
customer_reviews.author: prettyyeyes386

customer_reviews.title: loved how small it was
customer_reviews.text: Lasted for 2 1/2 years with no issues, loved how small it was. The only downside I didn't like was having to keep buying batteries. However, I dropped it in the sink full of water back in September of last year, and while it seemed to be working fine, it started acting up in December. It would stop clearing my steps/resetting at midnight and would often not respond, and the battery kept showing as low, and then would go back to normal. I replaced it with a used Fitbit One (chosen for the rechargeable battery) and have had no issues as of yet with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Love the Zip!
customer_reviews.text: I love that I wear this on my waist and that I don't have to wear it on my wrist. It does a good job of keeping track of my steps. The battery has a good life and is easy to change. Sometimes it doesn't always sync easily, but eventually syncs.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Statler

customer_reviews.title: Not very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable if you’re tracking activity history or participating in a step challenge. I had over 10K steps yesterday and it didn’t register on the app (this is the 3rd time that’s happened). The device also constantly says I have a low battery even right after I change it (I contacted them and they couldn’t help me). This FitBit isn’t bad if you’re casually watching your daily steps, but I wouldn’t rely on it for more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Good idea, crappy device. Bought in February, 2015. First battery (6 month life it says) died after 1 month. Replaced it, 2nd battery made it about 6-8 weeks. Updating firmware, resetting device on my phone, and all the other things the site recommends didn't work. It's now been through 4 "6 month" batteries in less than 10 months. Now it won't work correctly at all, even with a new battery. Will turn on, count that you've walked a few steps, than resets to zero. Won't pair with phone anymore, either. All the remedies their site suggested didn't help. I would not buy this again, and suggest you save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Great first pedometer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my girlfriend and it's perfect for her. She doesn't have to charge it, which she likes and it does a good job keeping track of her steps. She like that it clips to her clothes. She accidentally forgot to take it off before washing her pants and it came out the other side like nothing happened, not the off brand I had been using before we both went to Fitbits. Its a great product for someone who's just getting into tracking steps.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Morgenthaler

customer_reviews.title: Practically a Ripoff: Rubber holder not designed to last and cost at least $20 to replace.
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaint until 9 months later the rubber holder broke and I found out that it costs $20+ to replace it. This is pure ripoff for a little piece of rubber. Yes, the Fitbit Zip is well priced. But they eventually get you. The rubber clip is NOT designed to last and you basically pay a recurring price of $20 every 9-12 months. I also searched all around. It zip holder costs about $18 on ebay. $14.95 at the Fitbit store but $20 plus change after shipping and tax. I can't seem to find any other cheaper seller or alternative. Other listings here in Amazon and ebay frequently priced it above $25... pretty crazy in my humble opinion.
customer_reviews.author: P. To

customer_reviews.title: It's nice. I didn't want all the frills of the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's nice. I didn't want all the frills of the Fitbit bands (and I have a watch I prefer to wear). Kept track of steps pretty accurately and I liked the Fitbit app. However, it drains battery (in a year of owning it I'm on battery three or four). It also has started to show low battery when I know the battery is fine and sometimes the display won't turn on when I try to activate it. It's okay but don't have high standards.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing quality -- they last only a few months
customer_reviews.text: This is my third or fourth Fitbit. They simply have poor manufacturing quality. The early models that clipped on lasted a year at best before the clip broke. This model has stopped recording more than about 20% of my steps, and it's only 7 months old. Today, with a full battery, I walked briskly for 60 minutes with someone whose pedometer recorded roughly 7000 steps. My Fitbit? Only 1100. Why have I bought so many? Because the older models would at least count your steps before they fell apart. This one hasn't fallen apart but it has stopped counting many of my steps. This is my last Fitbit. For $100 I expect them to last more than 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: J. Raden

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these over the years. Never any problems or issues. I tend to lose them before having one malfunction. This one just doesn't work. I did get it synced but it doesn't capture work outs or sync regularly. I've changed the batteries three times hoping it was a battery issue. Must just be defective. My loss.
customer_reviews.author: Angeline

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY A ZIP
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit specifically to pair with the fitness app on my phone (galaxy S9) The zip will NOT sync with my phone unless I pull the battery from my Zip and reset it. Apparently Fitbit has been working on this for months without any fix. (There are many forum postings on this problem. Unfortunately , I didn't see any of those postings before I bought this.) If I hadn't thrown away my original packaging I would have sent this back. All it does for me is count steps.....something a simple $10-15 pedometer I could buy anywhere could do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item, wish it showed active minutes like the app
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Zip about three weeks now. It's the easiest thing to do, put in my pocket or on my waistband and go. No thinking required. So far with having it I have done my best to increase my steps daily as I have a desk job and know I need to get up and move more. The only thing that doesn't display on the Zip that the Fitbit app has is the active minutes. Wish this could be incorporated as one of the displays that toggles around. Other than that it's been something that's helping me realize I can get myself in shape by being one piece to the puzzle.
customer_reviews.author: HoudinisAngel

customer_reviews.title: Great device and weighs nothing!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving my wireless Fitbit Zip. It weighs next to nothing and easily clips on to what ever I am wearing. It tracks every step I take plus I put my food intake in as well (by way of smart phone) and it does all of the calculating. I do not like wearing watches so this really works well for me. I could not be happier and highly recommend this handy guide that gives me reality as to how much I am really moving.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool for increasing daily activity levels during the workday
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for increasing daily activity levels during the workday. I was amazed at how little activity I get and the small changes I've made to compete with myself to at least make 6,000 steps per day are definitely helping to get me more active. Also all the complaints about the battery and its tool seem a little overrated. I originally put the battery in using the tool and I've saved it in a safe place in my dresser. Simple as that. I'm looking forward to being able to shed the next 20 lbs!
customer_reviews.author: I love amazon!

customer_reviews.title: Not for the long run.
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase the fitbit zip. It's a perfect until the battery runs out. Then it has no functionality. Battery door tool is, perhaps perfectly designed for misplacement. If you loose the battery door tool, there is no replacement for sale from Fitbit, the coin method does not work, the Fitbit customer service offers a "25%" discount on new Fitbit replacement model, after half hour of answering questions. I just want to replace my battery and keep using the same device.
customer_reviews.author: J Xu

customer_reviews.title: Love my Fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned the Fitbit Flex and decided to switch to the Zip because the Zip is battery driven and doesn't require charging. Plus, I don't like wearing something around my wrist continually and I'm not interested in tracking my sleep pattern. The Zip is compact, can be worn on just about any piece of clothing and provides the time, steps, miles, and calories used, which is all I need. You can download the app to your Smart phone and track how you're doing over time. I've found the Fitbit products to be very reliable and their customer service is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Panchi

customer_reviews.title: Not super accurate, but very cute!
customer_reviews.text: I like my little Fitbit Zip! It is real cute! One problem is it is having a hard time tracking on both my computer and phone at the same time. It will only do one or the other at one time. But it syncs with my Sparkpeople page seamlessly! I think it is overstating steps, too, as when I picked it up one morning, it recorded 6 steps for that small move. That explains why sooo many people on the friends lists have 20k or more as their daily step counts. Either that or they are all working jobs that have them on their feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Julie in NM

customer_reviews.title: I also didn't like wearing the rubber band because I sweat so much
customer_reviews.text: I have the fitbit flex but I got tired of the visual dots saying I needed an update when I wanted to see how many steps I took. I also didn't like wearing the rubber band because I sweat so much. I bought the zip and am so happy with it. No more ugly bands....no more guessing how many steps, calories and miles I have walked. It's all there with a clear easy to read face. You can attach it anywhere discreetly. I am not knocking the flex...it has more functions but all I really wanted the zip monitors just fine. Great price...fast shipment.
customer_reviews.author: sister

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - a MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: This is small, accurate, and syncs easily with my iPhone. I keep it clipped in my bra and no one knows that I'm wearing a pedometer. The Fitbit app is great as well and also syncs it's information with My Fitness Pal app which makes keeping track of my activity and food tracking extremely accurate. This product has given me a much more accurate view of my daily activeness that I can't image not wearing it. I check it a few times a day and it pushes me to do a bit more, to park farther away, or to take the stairs instead of the elevator. A must have for those looking to be more aware of their fitness levels.
customer_reviews.author: Farrah Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Sent to island of misfit gadgets.
customer_reviews.text: This is the thrid fitbit product I have owned. I was hoping to link with my Ipad 2 but the bluetooth is not a new enough version. I have to boot up a PC to up load my data. By the time you boot up Windows go online and "tell" fitbit to sync your looking at a minimum of 15 minutes of frustration. If I could manually add my steps to the ISO app I would be happy but no, can't do that. Pros: more rugged than previous versions. Doesn't take up much space in the drawer of misfit gadgets. Cons: doesn't sync with older IOS devices. App desn't allow manual adding of steps Doggle doesn't work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt

customer_reviews.title: Indestructable and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Fitbit Zip for a long time and have always found it very reliable. It has gone through the wash several times with no ill effects. I have a Fitbit watch, but have not been satisfied with it. It was replaced 3 times, and now it just quit working. I'm back to my old standby, the Zip. It is easy to wear and never breaks down. It gives me a good indication of how many steps I have taken. Glad I kept that old thing so it can fill in when my watch fails.
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine McKaskle

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy wearing one
customer_reviews.text: This my second one of these. I got a lot of use out of my first one, but dropped it so many times that it finally died. They are very durable IMO. I really enjoy wearing one. I think it's accurate. Only drawback is that it's easy to become obsessed with steps, calories, etc. There are worse obsessions. Because the clip is so secure, the cover can start to come off or apart due to the strain of--in my case--forcing it over the thick denim seam of my pants pocket every day or several times a day. A little electrical tape kept me going for quite some time. Replacement covers are available.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Fitbit Charge HR but found that I wasn't getting my steps while grocery shopping. It seemed to work OK if I put it in my pocket but it wasn't designed for that. I ended up buying the Zip looking for something small that I could keep in my pocket or clip to my pants. This little tracker does the job. It doesn't have all the functions of the Charge HR but I've found that I don't miss them.
customer_reviews.author: Oranges

customer_reviews.title: I love the fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I love the fitbit...but it doesn't consistently work. For the price I had expected a device that lasted at least a year. My third replacement just quit today. I've emailed support and I hope that they can resolve it for me. They were very fast to ship replacement prior times but had I known that it was going to work only for 2 months or a couple weeks (I've had three and the lifetime varied from 2 weeks to 3 months) I would've purchased the more expensive model or another brand to have one that lasted longer. It is frustrating when you are trying to track your steps and the device keeps quitting.
customer_reviews.author: Lydse

customer_reviews.title: Easy Way to Track Activity Level!!
customer_reviews.text: Fitbits are the ultimate in pedometers - small, light weight, not affected by perspiration, and very accurate. Have used my fitbit in conjunction with my GPS marathon watch - accurate to withing 1-2% of total distance. Invest in this type of pedometer if you want to have one that can do a bit more that just track steps in 1-plane. The online support program can be as useful and interactive as you choose and the interface between the fitbit and my pc is so easy my senior-aged Mom can manage the sync process. And, the clip is super sturdy.... you're not likely to have this fall off, get knocked off you pants, or land in the toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Deal hunter

customer_reviews.title: Fed up with fitbit website
customer_reviews.text: Bought fitbit zip and really like the product and keeps accurate steps. However in past month can not use the zipbit connect to manually connect to your daskboard and fitbit will not auto sync. This happened 3 times in past month.. reported problem,and fitbit says working on problem. well have now had same problem 2 more times in past few days. would not buy again... the product is good, there support stinks
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa from ohio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed my FitBit, it lasted several years and even a cycle in the wash machine. Oops! Really great product, accurate, and easy to use App - I look forward to getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: A Little R & R

customer_reviews.title: They are great when they work
customer_reviews.text: This is my third fitbit. They are great when they work, but they seem to freak out after a year. Very easy to lose too. I purchased a bob to clip to my pocket and has string that I attached to the fit bit. It has saved me a few times when the fitbit has slipped out of my pocket or the clip on the fitbit became faulty. I like the zip because I don't have to wear it as a watch and I don't want to invest in one of the higher tech devices. It is definitely expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Married in PB

customer_reviews.title: Trouble replacing battery
customer_reviews.text: This is the second fitbit I ordered and i will be returning this. I thought maybe the first one was defective because I could not get the back off to replace the battery. The new one has the same issue. I even ask others to try thinking it was just me. They could not get the back off either.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Read some reviews and took a shot at ...This Works as stated!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a cheap competitor's one at local store... What a waste of time and money there! I then read some reviews and took a shot at this Fitbit. WOW! It actually works as intended... It doesn't count while driving or sitting but does count fairly good when it's supposed to. The free connection and APP also work well. The only thing I couldn't find was how to reset it.. Apparently, it automatically resets to Zero a midnight? But, yes definitely would recommend this to anyone looking to monitor your daily walking/running... I will trash the Walmart ones and buy my wife a Fitbit Zip.....
customer_reviews.author: oldguy

customer_reviews.title: Works good but only on my shoe
customer_reviews.text: Works good but only on my shoe. I use it with Sparkpeople to record and track activity. My Spark tracker (lost it) knew different activities steps, biking. This one only knows steps. I like the fact that it records the steps and sync with Sparkpeople. Update: zip does not log all the steps. Out of 100 it logs 33. Did a chat on fit bit and they are sending a new one. I read all the "bad" reviews and am hoping my second one will have better results. I will repost my update later and change my rating accordingly.....
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but an overpriced pedometer.
customer_reviews.text: Never liked it. Wanted to get another Fitbit One, but they don't make it. This doesn't light, so can't see in the dark, replaced the battery after only a few months and then it just quit working all together after having it only 4 month. Over $100 for a 4 month life. Super lame. Says my return window was only 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: K.T.

customer_reviews.title: I love that the battery stays good for weeks or months
customer_reviews.text: I love that the battery stays good for weeks or months! I couldn't remember to charge something every day (except my cell phone, because who can live without that?) I have trouble knowing where to put this on my clothes that I won't forget about it and wash it, but that is certainly not a manufacturer problem. 5 stars for this one, a no-hassle, easy to use tracker that has cute faces on it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Fun and perfect tracker
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for me - I lost my other one. I LOVE my fitbit zip! I've had one for many years and it works perfectly. It is little, comfortable, and does the job to keep me on track to meet my step goal. I like that I can clip it on my waistband and it is not noticeable. I would recommend any Fitbit product. The few times I have contacted the company they have been quick to respond, helped me through my questions, and provided excellent customer service above and beyond what is expected.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: The battery life seems to be great, as far as I can tell after only ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a Fitbit One that I ended up putting thru the washer/dryer. It worked afterwards, but not as consistently as before the wash, so I purchased a Zip. After several weeks of using the Zip, the only real differences (that I care about) so far, is that it doesn't track flights of stairs, and that it uses a disposable "watch-type" battery, versus a rechargeable battery. The battery life seems to be great, as far as I can tell after only 17 days of usage, still showing a full charge. I Highly recommend it, as it is just as accurate as the One, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Esper

customer_reviews.title: I love it as a clip on so I am not ...
customer_reviews.text: Received and set up my Fitbiz Zip May 2. Now on May 10, the battery is draining quickly. I read the Community posts on the Fitbit web site from other owners of the Zip with the same problem - battery drains quickly. Otherwise I would have given 5 starts as this is exactly what I wanted. I love it as a clip on so I am not wearing a wristband Fitbit. I am not looking forward to replacing this battery every 10 days and I hope Fitbit finds a solution.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moser

customer_reviews.title: I attempted to set up the fitbit to sync with ...
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to set up the fitbit to sync with my phone and computer, however it wouldn't work. Spent a couple hours on the phone with the fitbit company trying to figure it out but it must be faulty and I'm sending it back for a replacement. I've used them before, but I've never had this happen. UPDATE: So I sent the fitbit to be fixed/replaced, I sent the whole package, they sent me back just the Fitbit, not the rubber case, no dongle, no key to remove the back. If I could give this 0 stars for customer service I would. this is ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Zip died prematurely !
customer_reviews.text: I had a Fitbit zip for 2 years, loved it until I lost it. Naturally I ordered a new one posthaste but unfortunately my second Fitbit zip has some kind of flaw. I ordered it in August and apparently the warranty is up. My problem is the battery cover does not fit flush so after changing a dead battery, there is no connection and my Fitbit remains dead. If I apply pressure with my finger directly on the battery, it connects but when I screw the back on, nothing. For $50.00, I am Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. O

customer_reviews.title: Zip has a lot of problems
customer_reviews.text: The zip is terrible. I have to replace the battery every 2 weeks, pull the battery out and put it back in about once or twice a week to get it to synching, and lately it's been falling asleep and not counting steps. I bought a second one thinking my first was a lemon, but found it had the exact same problems. Save your money, get something else!
customer_reviews.author: Lara C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps track of activity well
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent way to keep track of the activity. Pros Syncs easily with my iphone app keeps track of my movement well The miles/steps are accurate. I checked with my treadmill reads and the numbers sync perfectly Price is very good cons It's very small and sometimes in the middle of things I lose it and finding it can be tough. If you are as busy as I am get the wrist version It's a clip on and sometimes I leave it on clothes and almost throw into the laundry ones. It can fall down (thankfully the excellent barista at Peet's found it and guessed it was mine) If I lose this, I will definitely buy the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Tanuja H Peiris

customer_reviews.title: I like that I can just throw it into my pocket ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for almost 2 years now with no issue. Battery life tends to waver, but that's more a function of the battery quality than the Fitbit. I like that I can just throw it into my pocket and not even think about it. Syncs up with the USB dongle easily, and you can export the data to MyFitnessPal or other logging sites to convert your steps to calories burned. It also stores data for several days - so even when I go on vacation, I can still sync it when I return to see how much walking I did. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Great Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a fitbug originally and unlike this product it did not include a dongle. Since the fitbug's dongle could not be ordered in the U.S. and their website had problems when I tied to order it and no phone number to place an order I gave up on it and invested in this instead. This fitbit is very well made and easy to set up an use. Big plus they have Ameican locations for producing and selling. I am looking forward to it's inspiring me to move more and get into better shape!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Zip Great tool!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE my fitbit! Keeps me going and motivates me when I am feeling lazy. I also bought one for my daughter in May, it stopped working, contacted fitbit and they are sending her another one, talk about standing behind your product! Don't have a bad word to say about the product or the company. If you need a kick in the butt, get one of these, if it helped me, it surely will help you too. Forgot to mention I love the friend feature, helps push you even more! To date I have lost 30 lbs, hoping to lose another 30.
customer_reviews.author: jules716

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for - an easy to use pedometer.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fitbit Zip! It is nice that it resets every midnight. I am not as wild about the dashboard. I mostly just write down my steps at the end of each day in a journal. I feel it is fairly accurate. Most days the number of steps is close to my estimate for the day. It is very easy to use. My biggest complaint is that the dashboard only sets goals for steps in increments of 5000. That is a big jump! I have looked for a simple pedometer for a long time - I have had several that simply did not work. I am quite happy with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Software issues?
customer_reviews.text: Want to like this but ihave to keep removing the battery and reset it just to update my daily activity. Bought anyone thinking it was just this one but the but the replacement one had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Works well, I just need something else for modivation
customer_reviews.text: The whole point of ordering this was to make me walk more. I haven't yet, though I have worn this every day for the last couple of months. I got it because it worked for my wife. She walks because she likes walking, and getting a version of this made her walk more and she liked the quantification of the steps that she gets and she competes with friends on the website. I like the website, but for me it is just constant verification of how sedentary I am. It's not a pretty picture. Maybe I just need the spring to finally come to the city. I'll withhold my final judgement until then.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edgar Mihelic, MBA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pedometer plus more
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of pedometers available but I think none are superior to this one. Fitbit makes several models. This one fits in your pocket and can be used as a key fob. Download an app to your smart phone and it wirelessly synchs up to give you a record of steps, distance and calories burned. (Of course these are estimates.) I track my weight on this app. Operation is as simple as can be. Fitbit emails you a record once a week. Recommend highly. I was asked how long the battery lasts. Fitbit emails you when you battery is low! They tell you what replacement battery to buy. Fitbit's customer service is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Jones

customer_reviews.title: weight loss tool
customer_reviews.text: this is a real diet motivator, you can go to the website and log in what you've eaten and it tells you how many calories you have eaten and burned and lets you know when you need to move more. You can match results with your friends and compete for goals. The only negative is it comes with no instructions and the website is not the best for help, but I got through it. I've lost more weight than I would have done on my own, Sadly the fit bit started going to sleep and refusing to wake up, But I was unable to return it or contact the seller though amazon
customer_reviews.author: wjm

customer_reviews.title: Battery problems not solved
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 fitbit zips and both have the same problem. The problem is that the original battery lasts 5 to 6 months but after that you're lucky if the battery last 1 week. I think the zip is the most accurate fitness step counter out there but I'm tired of spending money on batteries. The online help forums show that a lot of people have the same problem. They do give suggestions on how to correct this problem such as update software but that solves nothing. Goodbye zip, hello garmin vivofit or maybe vivoactive.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Battery needs replacing weekly. Do you like wasting money?
customer_reviews.text: Battery conks out every week. Literally every week like a charm. And unlike the Fitbit One you have to buy it. Who wants to drop $3 a week on batteries? Fitbit, get your act together, please make the Fitbit One again for those of us who don't want to wear it on our wrists and and relegate the zip to the dumpster. -- I spoke with tech support about it. They told me the battery problem affects all zips but that their engineers are working on a firmware update that they hope will fix it. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod B.

customer_reviews.title: I think I'll stick with my Omron pedometer
customer_reviews.text: My low rating is strictly due to my Fitbit being defective upon arrival (some of the dots were missing in the numbers, making 0 (zero) look like the letter "C" for instance). I love the online user interface and the syncing, but I think I'll stick with my Omron pedometerwhich tracks steps very accurately, and is so rugged it's survived the washer at least 20 times since I got it 3 years ago. Besides being washed so many times, the battery on the Omron has never needed replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho Libra

customer_reviews.title: Won't Sync
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to find that this device isn't rechargeable (my last fitbit was, so it didn't occur to me that this would be an issue). But I could live with that IF I could get it to sync with my phone. Even my techie buddy at work wasn't able to get it to work. She checked online and said this is a common problem with this model. I would like to return it and buy another model.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Fukuda

customer_reviews.title: Bought for wife as gift and she's an enthusiastic user
customer_reviews.text: We've been considering getting some type of "wearable" fitness device for some time, and Fitbit kept coming up as a favored option among friends we know using them. So I got this for my wife as a present, and she really loves it. The only "hiccough" was a brief period where it seemed to stop syncing with her IPhone (reason for four stars instead of five). Others have told us that just happens sometime and then it will start working again. Fortunately you can always sync via a computer with the USB device. I'll probably be getting one for myself after seeing how much my wife enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrewer

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead after two weeks WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Delivered to my doorstep on October 22. Battery dead by November 5. What an incredible disappointment. Friends have said their batteries have been going for 6 months. I still made sure to read up on the battery life and troubleshooting before purchasing. So I've checked and updated software this weekend when it first emailed me that the battery life is low. This morning I've tried removing the battery and reinstalling it. Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great Introductory Fitbit, LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for almost a month and love it, does what it is advertised to and I've had no problems I like that if I put it in my sock when I ride my recumbent bike it counts those "steps." I got a watchband for it so when I want to wear it that way I can and I've had no problems with the clip that came with it. The price is right for someone who like me who was not sure about getting one. Now that I know I like it and will use it in the future I may upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: fifty8th

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with android 9
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about the fit. And then I bought a Samsung Galaxy S9 with Android 9 (Pie). It will not pair. It will not sync. Apparently Fitbit has been trying to fix the problem for months and has been completely unsuccessful. There are currently 87 pages in the problem help section. So if you have a new phone, look elsewhere for a step counter.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cregg

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I should have read more reviews! Unfortunately the zip is not the one. It worked for 3 days. Then it stopped sincing with my app on my phone. Then by the 4th day the battery died. I didn’t realize it doesn’t have a charging capability. I thought the battery would last a little longer. Seems pretty wasteful. Is there a way to return this? I did what I could find for troubleshooting to help it sync and it still did not work. It clearly is dysfunctional and not working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Peck

customer_reviews.title: Lost it.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it until I lost it. I thought it was securely slipped to my jeans pocket. Guess I was wrong. I replaced it with the 2014 model of the Jawbone Move UP. Does everything this one does,and just as well, plus measures sleep activity and it was half the price. Not as pretty, though. I wear that one on my wrist. Both of these seem to have great clip-ons, but I can't afford to lose more than one. I am wearing the Jawbone on my wrist, which is recommended for sleep, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: NIfty Betty

customer_reviews.title: DISCONTINUED, DOESN'T SYNC - SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit no longer sells the Zip and it has a long history of not being able to sync with smartphones. Your money will be better spent on a different device, whether from Fitbit or elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: like a digital little remora hanging from my waist band
customer_reviews.text: My wife actually got a Zip before I did. Naturally, I had to demonstrate my masculinity and show her up, so I promptly ordered my own. I can now stride confidently as my trusty Zip dutifully logs every step and calorie burned, like a digital little remora hanging from my waist band. Once, however, my little Zip friend, normally so happy and smiling, turned into a spider. I nearly panicked. I consulted the instruction manual to no avail. I'm having trouble trusting him now.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty's Teeth

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. It fell off during a mild walk in the park. Im highly disapointed. The product should either be designed properly enough to stay attached to its owner's clothing or be priced low enough that replacement is feasible.
customer_reviews.author: DeCourtlanne

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love the FitBit Zip
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the FitBit Zip. Because I am a massage therapist, I am not able to wear something around my rest throughout the day. I needed something that could track my steps, track my mileage, and track my calories burned. This fit bit zip is a great product because I can clip it to my shirt, or to the top of my pants. So far, it's been very accurate. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: mschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is nowhere near advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works mostly as advertised, with the exception of battery life. I've had this exactly 39 days, and I've gotten my SECOND indication to replace my battery, so I'm averaging about 2 weeks per battery, as opposed to "up to 6 months" that the Zip is supposed to get. I'd honestly be thrilled with this device other than that and the lack of counting vertical flights, thus the knocking off of two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Remite

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed this fit bit for a little under a year
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this fit bit for a little under a year. However for the last few months, the time keeps resetting at various points of the day which throws off my step count. I have replaced the battery twice now, and it doesn't seem to make any difference. I would not waste my money on this tracker because it won't even last year. Disappointing, because everything else about this fit bit sounded great.
customer_reviews.author: Mssz

customer_reviews.title: It counts my "step" as I am driving and sitting at my desk at work
customer_reviews.text: Enough said. If I can't get an accurate count of my steps each day, this unit is worthless to me. I contacted customer service. They had a possible workaround (take the unit off when I am driving). But they had no answer except to tell me that the unit senses any movement and that is why it is counting steps I am not taking while sitting at my desk. I am returning it. Very disappointed because I had heard very good things about the product and I love the size.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Amorelli

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't change the time during Daylight Time--it is correct now. It isn't connected to my computer anymore so I can't trace my progress. I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought it again...
customer_reviews.text: I lost the first one after about 18 months so I bought another. It isn't fancy. It doesn't have the most bells and whistles. It is a pedometer. Measures steps. Using your (one time) input physical data, it converts steps to distance and calories burned. Also is a clock (in case you didn't have enough digital clocks around). Battery lasts about six to eight months and are relatively easy to change although they are not cheap. I sync mine via bluetooth to my Mac. I think it syncs to phones too. Small, not fancy, just works.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bristow

customer_reviews.title: Stronger clip but does not light up
customer_reviews.text: I have always used the clip fitbit and was sad to see they discontinued the small one. The new version is fine, probably a stronger clip-which is a plus as I had to replace mine a couple times. The downside is this one does not light up so it's impossible to see at night, shade or with sunglasses. Also the tap instead of the button method is not great. Firbit, bring the other one back please.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn E Wieligman

customer_reviews.title: Good, but clip holder could use some improvement
customer_reviews.text: Really loving my new Fitbit Zip. Tracking my steps pushes me to strive for to do more. So far working great. I have had no battery issues, but clip holder is less than desirable. After only a couple of days, plastic cover keeps coming apart from metal part of clip. Makes me worry about ruining my clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Love the Fitbit except the battery!
customer_reviews.text: I love having the fitbit. I clip it on, it stays on, no risk of coming off. It's a great motivator and definitely let me know how active (or inactive) I truly. am. I wear it all the time. My issues are 2 fold. 1. I lost the little device that helps you get the battery cover off the back and I guess that's the only thing that truly helps you get it off. 2. The battery lasted 6 weeks. So annoying! I'm going to look into how to get a better battery life out of it on their website. I've contacted customer service to see what can be done and then I'll re-post when I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hays

product_meta.title: Fitbit Zip Wireless Activity Tracker, Lime
product_meta.description:
Color:LimeTurn your everyday life into a fun path to fitness. Much more than a pedometer, zip tracks your steps, distance, and calories burned then automatically syncs the data to your Fitbit account. Whether online or through the Fitbit application, you can set goals and stay motivated to keep on your path to fitness with graphs, badges, and friendly competitions. Check to see how you compare with friends and family even provide a message to egg them on. Your stats wirelessly upload via computer or select mobile devices (like the iPhone 4S), so you will know in real time when you are close to a goal and when you've reached one.



FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

How do I reset my tracker? lf your tracker is not responding, it may be fixed by restarting.

 1. Open the battery door using the battery door tool and remove the battery.
 2. Wait 10 seconds.
 3. Place the battery back into the tracker with the "+" side facing up, and close the door.
 4. Your Zip will now be reset. You will see your tracker's version number, followed by a series of Fitbit Smilies. When you tap your tracker, you should be able to navigate through the screens as you normally would.

How do I reinstall the battery?


Your Zip's display is powered by a 3V coin battery, CR 2025. If your Zip won't turn on, it may be due to a drained or misaligned battery.

To reinstall the battery in your Zip:  1. Insert the battery door tool into the rear door slot of your Zip and turn it counter-clockwise to unlock the battery door.
 2. Remove the door and battery.
 3. Reinsert your battery with the positive (+) end facing up, and replace the battery door.
 4. Insert the battery tool and turn clockwise to lock the battery door. The door should be flush with the rear of the tracker.
feature_bullets: Tracks steps, distance and calories burned
Syncs automatically to your computer or select bluetooth 4.0 smartphones or tablets
Set goals, view progress and earn badges
Share and compete with friends throughout the day
Sync stats wirelessly and automatically to your computer and over 150 leading smartphones

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
